website_summaries.verdict: A vibrant and colorful diving sock that was built to last, effortlessly conform to your foot’s shape for the best fit possible, and keep your feet comfortable.
pros: Available in multiple sizes, extra-small to XXXL
Flexible, yet tough traction dot sole
Available in a rainbow of colors
cons: Although they are all affordable, some specific size and color combinations may be difficult to find online

customer_reviews.title: The fit is a pretty good fit
customer_reviews.text: The star rating is just pertaining to the fit and quality of this product, I have not used them yet. The fit is a pretty good fit, not tight but just snug enough to fill like they will not slip off. I bought size XS and I use a size 6 in women's and 4 in youth. The socks seem to be made really well but I will continue my review on a future date after I have used them. I used them at Havasu Falls where the water is around 70 degrees and the socks did what they were supposed to, they kept my feet from going numb.
customer_reviews.author: Aide M

customer_reviews.title: Great for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: I wore these in Hawaii while snorkeling in an area where there was a great deal of sharp coral, and although my knees got tore up a little, my feet were well-protected by these. The neoprene material is tough, and despite walking over rocks and coral, the socks didn't get cut up one bit. I also put my fins on over them when I went snorkeling, and had no problems with the fit. The socks were very easy to clean just by running them through water and dried in no time at all, ready to use again. I wear a size 11 1/2 shoe and ordered size XXL and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Guy J. Nasuti

customer_reviews.title: Thread unraveled and wrapped around my ankle
customer_reviews.text: Super dangerous!!!! The thread unraveled while swimming and WRAPPED ITSELF around my ankle while I was swimming in the ocean. It could just be a freak accident but I’m disappointed because he socks themselves worked excellently until this third use -.- I’m lucky it only wrapped itself around one since I was using it with a monofin. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Gochangco

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!......and not for what this is intended although I am a SCUBA diver!...I had an ankle repair and a side effect was minor plantar faciitis. Adding these neoprene booties did wonders!...For the most part....no more or at least minimal plantar fasciitis!....Sorry if the word fasciitis is wrong. Bottom line....first I'm a diver I can tell these do the trick of what this is intended......and second....It helped/cured my ankle issues!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Baker

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality!
customer_reviews.text: THIS is a REAL SWIM sock. Of the same neoprene material wetsuits are made. Tried it in the pool with various types of fins. They fit perfectly, protect feet from rubbing against the fin and keep tootsies warm. That is a must for swims in the open ocean or long snorkel hours. Look for 3 mm thickness. Nothing less! They run absolutely true to size. Use a meter measure and order the exact centimeters from big tow to back heel. I was surprised I had to order S. I don't consider my feet S in anything. Yet, this was, indeed, the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Triq Melita

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to find some swim shoes for water aerobics for a while now with no luck. Nothing is ever sized right. I'm a 7.5 medium. I found these water socks and thought.. OK let's try these. I'm so glad I did. These fit perfectly. They grip really well to the pools liner and they are not bulky in the water. I'll probably buy another pair as a back up. I'd definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki K

customer_reviews.title: So comfy! I wear them around the house!
customer_reviews.text: These are a neoprene material. Quick dry and take up hardly any room in a suit case! They work great to keep sand out form between your toes and they are great for walking on the beach if you don't wanna wear shoes. They also help cut back on the amount of rubbing your flippers do on your feet when wearing flippers. Extremely comfortable, I feel like they are giving my feet a nice hug!
customer_reviews.author: JMOO

customer_reviews.title: Good for short time use
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable on the feet, and will save your feet from wear and tear at a water park for the day, however, don't expect to get more than one use out of them if you wear them all day at a water park... they had holes in them along the sides and bottom by the end of the day, making them useless to use again. I'm sure they would last longer if you wore them for short stints, in a less wear and tear environments.... So the 3 stars are because the durability could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Mom

customer_reviews.title: nice item worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My short swim fins by finnis were starting to cut into my feet after wearing for a while so these swim socks provided the perfect comfortable solution. Now I can use my fins in complete comfort. I don't use them for walking around the pool like some folks do, as I suspect that this will decrease the life of the swim socks. They also seem to provide warmth. My imagination? I'll let you decide. I have a large foot 14" shoe - so I ordered the largest size. Fits well - if your the type who wants a really tight fit order another size down.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweigh but offer limited protection for my fins
customer_reviews.text: I liked these socks for being on the boat and they're comfortable, however, they were a bad match for the fins that I have. I used them without huge issues on my trip to Belize, but I clearly need a soled shoe/boot with these fins. I also can tell I need something 5mm or thicker for protection against chaffing. I'll keep these as they're good for wearing around the boat during surface intervals, and as back-ups in case something happens to my boots I'm about to buy.
customer_reviews.author: strobelight

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you are traveling to areas with stones and corals
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved them! I walked on the beach with small stones, pieces of broken shells and corals and never got a cut. It is not necessary on many beaches, but on some it is very important to protect your feet. I saw many people get cut walking barefoot. We were in Thailand, some beaches there have many small stones. It can become especially a big problem during low tide when you walk far. We also went to some areas with corals and they are very sharp. Definitely recommend. Shoes are comfortable, also protect you from hot sand. Quality is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: Will tear on rocks, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think they're good value and totally worth it. My wife and I took a pair each to Hawaii. They saved our feet from rubbing heels of flippers and saved us from some sharp rocks. After about 5 uses, mine had developed a scuffed hole under the big toe, which quickly spread to a couple inches wide. My wife's lasted all of two weeks until finally stitching started to undo - probably repairable. I wear size 12 to 13 US (for width) and the 2XL fitted perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like them, but the sizing is wrong
customer_reviews.text: I definitely have an issue with the suggested sizing. These should be a bit tight, like socks, so that they wrap your foot. I used the sizing chart for my shoe size and felt they were a bit too loose... so I ordered a size smaller and they now fit like a glove. So I definitely think I will like them in the water itself... but I think the sizing chart needs updating.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable foot protection for water/beach.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but I'd recommend ordering one size up from the chart. I ordered my son's exact size, but they were squeezing his toes. The quality seems to be great . Sadly, we didn't have them for vacay, but I will surely order another pair for next time! My son's toes get scraped up on the bottom of most pools. His water shoes become too heavy when he tries to wear them in a pool. I wanted to get him something lighter, yet more durable than a regular sock. These are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Pam M.

customer_reviews.title: I've only used them once so far
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size up because I was between sizes. Although they seemed a little loose-fitting, they stayed on my feet while I swam, and I wasn't wearing fins or anything on top of them. I ordered red, and they are nice and bright. The rubber soles aren't as thick as I was hoping-- I could still feel every rock, but it sure beat being barefoot! I'll try them with my fins next time, and I feel sure they'll be great. I'll edit my review if I have a problem early on in their use!
customer_reviews.author: Canny

customer_reviews.title: These Seavenger Wetsuits Premium Neoprene Water Fin shoes work perfect for walking on the sandy beaches and into the ...
customer_reviews.text: These Seavenger Wetsuits Premium Neoprene Water Fin shoes work perfect for walking on the sandy beaches and into the water especially where there are rocks/lava. I like them because it kept the sand off my feet and from between my toes and also, protected my feet from the lava/rocks before putting on my fins to snorkel in Hawaii. I am excited to have these to use on future snorkeling trips. I also will be use these at waterparks and swimming pools to protect my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mach

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are light weight, but it just right inside my fins. I am glad that I purchased them. No blisters, etc. Not sure if they were designed to keep your feet warm, but they are comfortable. Wearing them on the cement will tear up the bottoms quickly, but I usually have sandals on when I walk on the deck to protect them. They are comfortable to wear in the pool and at the beach. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for me. We went to Belize and did a cave tour that didn't allow shoes inside the cave. Much of the ATM cave (awesome btw, just google ATM cave Belize) is flooded so we were in the water and out on rocks. Theses things feel lightweight but held up to a 20+ min hike thru the jungle then 2+ hrs hiking in a cave. I was very surprised. Then I used them on there beach for the next few days. No tips, tears, holes or even cracks
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Allen

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These really protected my feet from my swim fins. They also worked great again hot beach sand and walking on some slippery rocks at the beach. They do fill with water, so make swimming in them difficult if not wearing fins. They smell weird when new, and if you do not rinse really well and dry thou roughly, they can smell downright awful. I liked them more than my husband did. They feel fairly sturdy and appear well made. I will probably get a second pair if these hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Vdub

customer_reviews.title: Not only do I use it with my fins, ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I use it with my fins, but the shore line can be full of broken shells. As a diabetic, I am very careful about my feet, cuts, infections, etc. I use these as "beach socks" to help prevent any injuries. It helps, but doesn't safe guard. Still I need to be careful when entering the water. Helps to walk on the hot hot sand too. VERY TRUE TO SIZE. Ordered my size & it is form fitting. Works for me.
customer_reviews.author: JKH-NYC

customer_reviews.title: These made my snorkel fins usable
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, I'd prefer to go barefoot when at the beach. However, the fins I bought have straps that I was afraid wouldn't stay on my ankles (too loose), so I bought these as a back up. I used the fins barefoot, and the straps were fine...however, the part where the tops of my toes touched rubbed and cut my toes. Socks to the rescue! They are comfortable, they dry fast, and they will be great in my kayak, too. Not a bad item to have in my outdoor gear collection.
customer_reviews.author: C. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE AND GOOD GRIP
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three pairs, for myself (LARGE wear men's 9.5), my son (LARGE wears men's 9.5-10) and my daughter (SMALL wears women's 6.5-7.0). We were all very happy with the fit. My son found them useful with his fins which run a little large but we all loved them for climbing over slippery rocks and boulders to get to the ocean for snorkeling/swimming They made more of a difference then I would have expected (found out the hard way when I tried this without the socks.). Only used for three days mostly for snorkeling, so can't comment on durability, but they held up fine for the time we used them.
customer_reviews.author: VITORIO

customer_reviews.title: Just a Fin Sock - Light Duty Only
customer_reviews.text: Not for direct walking. Fin sock only. My water exercise is pool walking, 45 minutes walking back and forth in a 4-foot deep swimming pool. The first time I did it, I wore a spot on the sole of one foot. So I bought these. After three more sessions, I found a ragged hole worn through at the ball of one foot. The nubs on the sole are by no means adequate to protect the neoprene from wear. . I wear a size 14. The fit was correct, and they were easy to get on and off, perhaps too easy to get off, which is consistent with my recommendation for light duty ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C.

customer_reviews.title: A dive sock for us small females!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I finally found a dive sock that fits! I am a very small adult female with 5.5 feet (US sizing). Finding shoes is always a frustrating venture for me. The 3XS in this sock fit perfectly. They do not wiggle or bunch up in my fins and fit like the second skin they are supposed to be. I can't speak to longevity but they seem decently made and should hold up as well as any other dive sock. And even if they don't, for the price who cares if they wear out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got these for family trip to hawaii
customer_reviews.text: Used these on the beach in hawaii, they worked well for protecting my feet from the coral and beach debris. They don't have a "sole" so they won't protect from something sharp going directly into them but they provided a nice option for when I didn't want wear shoes. My favorite aspect was that they did not rub my foot in a way that gave me blisters even after some sand got inside.
customer_reviews.author: ACDRS

customer_reviews.title: Not tough.  Not durable.  Fit well and were comfortable tho.
customer_reviews.text: In the description, it says they are good for a "whole day" of activity. They can be used for water aerobics and many other activities. The picture I attached was after two 35 minute "light jogging" sessions in the pool. I couldn't believe it; I might as well have worn a pair of paper socks. I guess if you are using them for just floating around in water, you might like them. They were snug, light weight, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality but worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable fit and could wear inside my sneakers. Perfect for hiking the narrows in Zion national park. The socks aren't super padded on the bottom so I wouldn't recommend wearing these alone if your planning on walking on rocks. They are perfect for the beach, or inside shoes. Be aware they aren't super high quality so they are good for a few wears but won't last years....maybe months if you don't use them hard.
customer_reviews.author: Neon177

customer_reviews.title: Good first impression, Update not as impressive
customer_reviews.text: I've wear these for water arthritis and water aerobics two forty minute classes 4 times a week . The socks were snug on my feet but not restrictive. I purchased the 3X size to fit my size 14 feet. I do not regret the purchase. As far as durability only time will tell, but they appear to be well made. Update: These wore through in just two weeks of use during water aerobics, very disappointing. The thinner cheaper Sitaile water socks lasted 2 to 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: GE Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: The Seavenger Zephyr 3mm Neoprene Socks met all my expectations. I like the fact that they're snug on my feet, and they allow me to wear the Seavenger booties over them, without having any major issues. The NON-SLIP GRIP — Dotted silkscreen sole is another feature I love about these socks. From the picture, I though the bottom of the sole was flat, but once opening my package, the dots were actually raised. Can't wait to use them on my next underwater adventure! Update! I bought a second pair, in a different color and they still met my desired expectations!!
customer_reviews.author: Egypt

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a family cruise, and my kids loved them! I really enjoyed them when we went snorkeling. My feet stayed warm, and they were very comfortable, even while wearing fins. Just like wearing a scuba suit, but for your feet! My only issue, which has nothing to do with the product itself, my 8 year old daughter has narrow feet/ankles, so lots of sand was getting into hers while at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Delivery
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the delivery instructions were not followed. Fed Ex , often in the neighborhood, was given 2 options for delivery.....the address where I am staying or the security guard gate in case I wasńt home.....he-she chose neither but left the box at the neighborhood office where the hours are very limited and the office was closed for 3 days (the 24th, 25th and 26th of December). I was notified by email by the office but didńt get it until after it was closed. As a result I did not have the gift to give at Christmas. Disappointing to all involved!!
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold water swim
customer_reviews.text: Got these for an early season triathlon. water is always really cold early on with snow melt filling the lake. these worked great. last year I couldn't feel my feet for 15min after getting out, this year with these on it was just about like not having been in the water.
customer_reviews.author: gabby 🙈

customer_reviews.title: Essential footwear
customer_reviews.text: The Seavenger Zephyr 3mm Neoprene Dive Socks are very useful and highly durable. The 3mm socks are thin enough to fit inside of dive fins and thick enough to provide foot protection when walking on sharp rocks and shells. I have used them at many beaches and they are very comfortable and extremely durable. I highly recommend these Seavenger Zephyr 3mm Neoprene Dive Socks!
customer_reviews.author: P. L.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, scratchy seam
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be a nice quality and are soft with a great anti-slip bottom. My only problem is I can feel the seam on the inside part of my foot at my arch. I thought maybe it was just a defect, but it scratches on both feet, so I assume it is how they are made. Worried this might rub or be really scratchy. Might keep for an extra pair, but would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: p888t

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy I purchased these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear under the fins provided by the cruise company. It make them much more comfortable and helped them fit more snug. I am very happy I bought them. I also used them as wet shoes on the beach when I was not snorkeling. Made well and I was happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: agalinmissouri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for under my fins.
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect dive socks to go under my short fins I use for snorkeling. They were great during my family vacation. The only complaint would be how water gets trapped in them when I'm coming out after a snorkel and that's something I can definitely live with as they keep my fins from rubbing my feet raw.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: These work great but they are a bit tight for the sizing chart. opt for the next size up if you are on the top end of a size.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach
customer_reviews.text: They work incredible my buddy talk to me about them before we went on our 1 week beach trip alll week on the sand i had the same pair on and i enjoy every second with them on they are not cheaply made I would highly prefer them I told tons of people about them because they thought I was wearing socks😂
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fit well
customer_reviews.text: Booties work well with my strap-back flippers. Easy on/off but stay on in the water, prevented abrasion from flippers. I can't speak to the durability of the soles because I didn't wall on sidewalk or road surfaces, nor on the rocks in the water entrance. But they don't look like they'd hold up for long under that type of use. The patterns of the fabrics are so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Shoppin Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear under snorkeling fins because I didn't want our vacation spoiled because of blisters. These worked perfect. They were very comfortable and were easy to pull off and put back on even when wet. They dried quickly. I am sure we will use them for other than snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you. These are great water socks.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for quality water socks. I purchased these to wear in my water shoes while hiking in the Narrows of Zion National Park. The fit was true to size for both my husband and me, and they were very comfortable. These will keep your feet protected and warm. I frequently get blisters with snug fitting footwear and was pleasantly surprised to see how well these socks protected my feet. Great product. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: book fan

customer_reviews.title: These are so awesome!! Easy to walk in the sand and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so awesome!! Easy to walk in the sand and protect feet from heat. Also easy to swim. They are not as restrictive as those water shoes. Easy to put on and take off, easy to rinse. Why didn't I buy these sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: amazonbear

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has very strong chemical smell. Took a while for it to go away. Design looks good and it is not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Yuen

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Would have given them five stars if they were a little more skin tight. They are quite valuable, as our swimmer in the family would have big blisters from the flippers if he wasn't also using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Cities citizen

customer_reviews.title: Keep my feet warm and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I have poor circulation in my feet, so I get painful cramps in my toes when in cold water--and since I live in an area where most of the lakes and rivers come right out of the mountains, all the local swimming holes remain cold throughout the summer. These socks keep my feet warm and comfortable, and I haven't had a single charley horse while swimming since I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Sibella

customer_reviews.title: Best water socks
customer_reviews.text: Best water socks I've had. Fit my size 13 foot perfectly. They are easy to put on and take off and form around the foot nicely. Used these while snorkeling and walking around boat docks. The soles have a decent grip to keep you from slipping. I even walked on sharp gravel with them a bit and it didn't damage them and gave me some protection.
customer_reviews.author: starfan72Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pick
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a trip to Hawaii and wore them every day. They fit well and are comfortable. They are great for on the beach, rocks or in the water. I got them in both blue and black as I'll use them a lot back at home for kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bootie for snorkeling with dive fins
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly for my wife. She wanted a very low bootie to use with her dive fins while snorkeling to prevent a tan line. These were much lower than her dive boots and worked well with her fins. It was exactly what she was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marois

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear in a crew boat. They were thick enough and had enough traction to be able to walk without other shoes and take the boat out to the water and back. They work well in the mounted shoes. I would wear them for SUP, kayaking, the beach on hot sand.
customer_reviews.author: mcsparky

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but stretched out a bit
customer_reviews.text: I was in between the med and the small I went with the medium but they have stretched out a bit, now I have to buy a small, I'm a size 7 womens, otherwise they are great to have, protects your feet when walking across rocks and shells until you can get into the water to put on fins.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Family

customer_reviews.title: Fit like socks
customer_reviews.text: I do really like these!!! The socks have a thin membrane on bottom, fit like a form fitting sock. My 10 y/o used these instead of watershoes at a lake, worked great and there were a few children that wanted to try them out.??? Any way, I can find a million different uses for them . It was a great investment for foot protection and a fun way of keeping fins on feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rhaelee BooHer

customer_reviews.title: Fit my big feet perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is 13 or 14 depending on the shoe, and the 3XL version of these fit me perfectly. I usually wait until I go on vacation and have to buy these in a gift shop near the beach and even when I find a XXL pair, they never fit. These are perfect and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in durability
customer_reviews.text: My son wore these first time to try them out in our pool. We have a pebble plaster finish. In less than 20 min it tore up the bottoms, on one sock there was a hole all the way through. I really thought they would be more durable. Pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Roman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome ! I wear a 10/10.5 and got a large in size , walking around the southern most point in key West you have coral Stone and these helped so much , also once I put my fins on these offered more comfort to the wear ! Very please with these
customer_reviews.author: patrick orth

customer_reviews.title: Great foot protection
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They work well under my swim fins and as stand alone socks for walking in the hot pool deck in Arizona. I would definitely recommend and buy again. I wear size 7 women’s shoes and based on the reviews bought an XS. They fit exactly the way I want them to.
customer_reviews.author: cmwillms

customer_reviews.title: So 5+ months in a chlorine pool is pretty good. I will try other labels just to ...
customer_reviews.text: I swim laps 5-6 mornings a week. I bought these back in Feb and they are just now coming apart. So 5+ months in a chlorine pool is pretty good. I will try other labels just to see if they match up.
customer_reviews.author: slant69

customer_reviews.title: Wore these for 3 weeks in French Polynesia
customer_reviews.text: I used these most every day while on a big snorkeling trip. They are soft so you can feel the lava beneath your feet but the tread is strong enough to protect you well. I should have ordered one size smaller but they worked just fine for me. They were able to fit inside my fins if need be or easily tucked away when snorkeling. Not for everywhere walking but for protection when on your way to a snorkel site. Loved them and will bring them on future trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: stitching didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: Displeased w/product--sock threads have started unraveling. I would not be saying anything due to nearly a year & a half, but due to injuries & my pool closing at the end of 2017, & not being in another pool until recently, very displeased. Poor quality. Previous socks, different company, lasted much longer. And they were kept inside, shouldn't have done that.
customer_reviews.author: Z...23227

customer_reviews.title: Great foot protection!
customer_reviews.text: I went on a family cruise and decided to purchase rather than rent snorkel gear for myself, wife and son. This set saved us money, rental fees and ingesting other snorkelers' germs. We snorkeled at two ports and this set more than paid for itself. The booties saved our feet from chafing. We're cued up for our next cruise!
customer_reviews.author: Artie Kay

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to water shoes
customer_reviews.text: stays on, great alternative to water shoes. lets you really kick hard when you have flippers without having to deal w/ hard plastic on your bones. you would think that the ankle retainment is the hardest part, but no issues with fins falling off. if you have fins with the ratchet strap on the rear, even easier. also helps walking over hot boat surfaces and rocks without issue. cleaning is easy; fill with hot water and hang dry.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: very helpful, i actually like this better than the water shoes because its easier to remove and to clean after use, dries faster than the shoes. It does the same comfort as the shoes and this is even more comfy. water stay inside to make you warm and it really protects your feet when walking in the beach with a lot of rocks. Works like wonder while in hawaii and a must have when snorkeling and walking around beach
customer_reviews.author: Anne Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well made. 6 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these 10+ hours a day for over 16 months and they're still in great shape! I have plaque psoriasis on my feet and use creams to keep it in check. My Seavenger Dive Socks keep my feet from drying out and keeps me from leaving sticky footprints everywhere I go. I wear them over cotton socks. Size XXXL is just right for my size 12 foot. GREAT PRODUCT ******!
customer_reviews.author: C&BinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks for Monofins and Scuba Fins!
customer_reviews.text: These worked amazing for my mermaid Monofin from Suntails! It kept my feet from rubbing together inside of the Monofin’s foot pockets and most importantly kept them inside. People apparently mistake these for water shoes but these aren’t made for rough terrain. Don’t buy them for that and then complain that they tore whilst you were navigating rocks and course gravel, you were using them wrong
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: What I love about these is the feel and the VERY grippy ...
customer_reviews.text: What I love about these is the feel and the VERY grippy bottoms. If you snorkle in an area that has rocks, in the warmer months those surfaces can become slippery with algea growth. regular snorkle socks have smooth soles, but these, although totally smooth inside have a rough texture on the bottom which is amazing. even if you dont need that I highly recommend these. HIGHLY. this is my 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.author: Yet another Whitney

customer_reviews.title: It is made well and looks like it is going to last longer than the one ...
customer_reviews.text: The size is a little snug but works OK. The color is starting to fade due to the chlorine of the water. It is made well and looks like it is going to last longer than the one I had previously. That one disintegrated due to the chlorine.
customer_reviews.author: mmsquare

customer_reviews.title: I have not worn them yet but so far I like them. They are not bulky and I think ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go under my fins. They fit really tight and fit under my fins. I have not worn them yet but so far I like them. They are not bulky and I think will be very helpful when walking on a stone covered beach or trying to get in to snorkel when it is rocky.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Theis

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up...
customer_reviews.text: Work great...fit perfectly. i have nerve damage to the bottom of my feet that was keeping me from swimming...these booties have made swimming again possible and enjoyable for me.
customer_reviews.author: ca8050

customer_reviews.title: cheap crap, do not
customer_reviews.text: used these for a month on Bunaken Indonesia. The stitching came out in the first week and by the end of my trip they were coming apart. cheap crap, do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hruby

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable...Well made
customer_reviews.text: Work great with my fins and prevent rubbing. Sizing is accurate. Like the bottoms as they help prevent slipping on wet surfaces...not for wearing alone unless going into surf for beach dive.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I needed for my snorkel fins since dive boots did not work with them and my feet were always cut up and sore when I used my fins with bare feet. They were a good weight similar to a 3 mm wetsuit. Also provided some protection from shells and seaweed.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey D

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time, as described and in new condition. GREAT for use inside my SCUBA boots used with my fins to keep myself warm in colder weather/water. These are cute, warm and have grippers on the bottom. Protection from the hot sand pavement.
customer_reviews.author: B4Me

customer_reviews.title: Fits great!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for a trip to Israel. They traveled flat in our backpacks and worked great in the Jordan River, Mediterranean Sea and Dead Sea. Water does get into them though. They dried within a day and could be used as slippers in the hotel, too. So if you pack light and want to protect your feet on hot sand these work great!
customer_reviews.author: PJD

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: I love these things, definitely worth the buy to add to your gear. They also doubled as perfect water shoes for when we were hanging out on the beach or just swimming. The worked perfect with my flippers too.
customer_reviews.author: TINA N TRAVIS

customer_reviews.title: a must buy
customer_reviews.text: These "water socks" as we call them are awesome deff recommend. in my opinion they run a little big but was to expect due they dont have individual sizes besides that they held up great i walked with them on sand, concrete, bricks and even harsh coral for 6 days on my recent vacation to san andres, CO and i would say i put at the very least 30 hours on them and they are still on great condition (besides some tarmac stains) yes they would get hot if walking on concrete after a while but dumping some water on them will keep you going
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Castro

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and are very comfortable! I bought these to use as liners in snorkeling fins and in water shoes, very comfortable. I wear a size 6 in women's shoes and this size was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Poss

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use
customer_reviews.text: Will be using soon. But this couple with the fins appears to be a great combination. New to snorkeling and a little nervous, but looking forward to this new adventure. So I bought what I thought would give me more confidence. These appear to fit into that plan. Fit very well. Arrived as ordered. Now to use. Now I'm looking forward to snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: tequila e. langham

customer_reviews.title: the best fitting water socks
customer_reviews.text: We tried a few other water socks that were less expensive but had to return them all because the fit was so weird. These fit all members of our family perfectly, nice and snug so they work well for use inside a snorkel fin.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't skip the socks.
customer_reviews.text: I am SO glad we thought to get these socks before our snorkeling honeymoon .. our feet would have been so chafed otherwise, and we would have been scrambling to find something while on vacation. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Throm

customer_reviews.title: Great socks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for snorkeling in Hawaii. They worked great. We were able to wear them on the rockier beaches and kept our feet protected. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J-dawg

customer_reviews.title: Proper sized 12 5E
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 5E shoe. 3x fits me perfectly without binding my toes or cutting off my circulation. They are very comfortable and I actually like wearing them around the house as they keep my feet very warm. I seem very durable but only time will tell. I don't think you can go wrong with these
customer_reviews.author: BBG

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought those!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought those socks. I didn't wear fins for snorkeling, I was just wearing those socks and was able to walk on a rough rocky surface into the ocean. I have a water shoes as well, but didn't like to swim with shoes on my feet; swimming and wearing my water socks felt like swimming bare-feet and I loved it! Additionally, socks dried very fast and seem to be a good quality.
customer_reviews.author: irina mcd

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I was buying another brand over and over ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I was buying another brand over and over because they kept ripping at the seams but this brand is holding up. No ripping, fraying, etc. They are holding up but when they do go, I will buy these again and not the other brands!
customer_reviews.author: Krazy4MJJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for the pool with infant!
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great for the pool! I was a bit afraid to take my infant in the pool in case I slipped, but once I put these on, it made me feel at ease. They fit great (nice and snug so it securely stays on) and feel great on as well. Its wasn't weird wearing them at all. I also like the hygienic factor of not having to walk the pool area barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Semmy

customer_reviews.title: Great for wearing fins
customer_reviews.text: Used these with my snorkel fins and am pleased with the results. I would recommend these to anyone who's looking to protect their feet while snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: timshrader

customer_reviews.title: Great socks. Questionable durability?
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these socks. They are comfortable and work great when sweep rowing (how I user them). However, I can't give them a 5 because after a weekend of intense rowing, I looked down and there were large holes in the soles of the shoes, right where I was pushing off in the boat. Am not sure if this was from the rowing or walking to my car on a rougher surface weekly. But they lasted 5-6 months in great shape until this weekend. Really bummed.
customer_reviews.author: SL N.

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome!!!! Bought two pairs for my boyfriend and I's new snorkel fins. Fit well and we didn't get one blister! Also work great as lightweight wading shoes to help protect your feet from broken shells and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Grey

customer_reviews.title: Useful and helps keep feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: Really make a difference when water gets cold. I would consider the style going over ankle though to be extra darn and prevent water from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dive Socks rule!
customer_reviews.text: I take these with me on vacation, since they are tiny, and if I go on a snorkel trip, they make the fins that I rent totally comfortable. They are also excellent to wear inside sandals when walking in cold water, or if I get a blister/scrape because I wasn't wearing them the day before. Like ankle socks, but foam rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: mostly using them as house slippers but also for extra warmth when it hits the negatives outside. makes a great additional liner for any boots. They conform well to my feel and and keep me warm even with my poor circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: If you love warm feet; these are for you!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always searching for ways to keep my always cold feet warm. At this time of year, shearling slippers are too warm. Then a light bulb went off ... I already have neoprene toe warmers for my winter boots and love them for their warmth. Why not neoprene booties? I'm so glad I found these cause the heat's off for the season, and I still have warm feet! And when my feet are warm, all is good!
customer_reviews.author: winterlilycat

customer_reviews.title: “...Fit Me Perfectly.”
customer_reviews.text: Wearing a USA size 12M, I ordered the size XL which fit me perfectly. With the Seavenger socks on my feet I slip easily into my swim fins for a nice and snug fit. I am happy and would certainly buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Kahanalu1

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works great
customer_reviews.text: Love these, fit as expected and feels great - even when walking on rocks. I use these when diving in colder waters - provides extra cushioning with fins as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Grad

customer_reviews.title: Cute and comfortable water socks
customer_reviews.text: I really like my neoprene socks for snorkeling and the pool. I wear a 6.5-7 women’s shoe and got a small. They fit perfect and are comfortable while protecting my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great bootie!
customer_reviews.text: These fit like I thought they would, are super comfortable! Fit great under my flippers and I also use them for sand volleyball on cold days! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Holes started to form with first use. By the second use, there were large holes. My husband is diabetic so we are looking for something to protect his feet when in our pool or at the beach. If anyone can offer affordable suggestions, please comment to this review. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: beautifulday4k

customer_reviews.title: ! ! ! MEASURE YOUR FEET ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: I received the product today so this review is for "FIT" only. I will update if necessary after I use them. My U.S. shoe size is 10.5. My left foot is 27.0 centimeters and my right foot is 27.5 centimeters. I purchased a "LARGE" and they fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again - great fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and works with my flipper that I use in the salt water swimming pool at our gym. Wearing the rubber flipper without swim socks rubbed skin off my toes. The swim socks solved my problem. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CindyLou

customer_reviews.title: Must to have if walking on the beach
customer_reviews.text: I always take them swap my slipps with them before i get into the hot sand..i dun feel anything except of there are sharp rocks..great product easy to wash..very convenient
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got them
customer_reviews.text: great fit, really comfortable and protect the sides of my ankles from fin chaffing. Use them everyday for a half mile swim
customer_reviews.author: Michael Slayton

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than expected.
customer_reviews.text: These are really cute, true to size but thicker than I thought they would be. I bought them to wear snorkeling and they are just a little too thick to wear with my fins. I’ll probably keep them but I wish they were thinner.
customer_reviews.author: susan torlone

product_meta.title: Seavenger Zephyr 3mm Neoprene Dive Socks
feature_bullets: CONSERVES BODY HEAT — 3mm neoprene provides insulation for cooler waters.
SUPER STRETCHY — 4-way stretch material forms to your foot for a comfortable fit.
RELIABLE DURABILITY — Glued and blindstitched seams minimize water flow and maintain strength.
MULTI-USE SOCKS — Ideal accessory for snorkeling, diving, water aerobics and other water sports.
NON-SLIP GRIP — Dotted silkscreen sole keeps you from slipping or falling.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
